department_information.name: Department of Computer Science
department_information.school: School of Computer, Mathematical, and Natural Sciences (SCMNS)

scmns_dean.name: Dr. Paul Tchounwou
scmns_dean.title: Dean, School of Computer, Mathematical, and Natural Sciences
scmns_dean.address: 1700 E. Cold Spring Lane, Baltimore, MD 21251

office_hours.note: Contact administrative staff for specific availability

department_information.mission: The Computer Science Program provides students with fundamental computer science knowledge and training, and prepares them to apply their knowledge and training to produce solutions to specific problems. Students learn to define a problem clearly, determine its feasibility and choose an appropriate solution strategy.
department_information.vision: We are dedicated to preparing students to be the next generation of scientists and professionals who will be able to compete effectively in the changing global society.
educational_objectives: Provide practical knowledge that will be of immediate use in the profession
Provide a solid foundation in theoretical computer science
Ensure graduates have the fundamentals necessary to acquire knowledge in a rapidly evolving discipline
Prepare students to compete effectively in the changing global society
student_learning_outcomes: Analyze a complex computing problem and apply principles of computing and other relevant disciplines to identify solutions
Design, implement, and evaluate a computing-based solution to meet a given set of computing requirements in the context of the program's discipline
Communicate effectively in a variety of professional contexts
Recognize professional responsibilities and make informed judgments in computing practice based on legal and ethical principles
Function effectively as a member or leader of a team engaged in activities appropriate to the program discipline
Apply computer science theory and software development fundamentals to produce computing-based solutions

accreditation.note: Morgan State University is designated as a Carnegie 'High Research' University
